SBRQ

A Four-State Behavioral State Model

April 17, 2025

Source: vignettes/MYZ-xde-SBRQ.Rmd
MYZ-xde-SBRQ.Rmd

Base Model

We present the following behavioral state model for mosquito ecology with four behavioral states:

Variables

  • SS the density of sugar feeding mosquitoes;

  • BB the density of blood feeding mosquitoes;

  • RR the density of resting mosquitoes;

  • QQ the density of egg laying mosquitoes.

Terms

Λ\Lambda is the emergence rate of adult mosquitoes.

Parameters

  • ff is the overall blood feeding rate; the inverse f−1f^{-1} describes the average time to blood feed after entering the blood feeding state

  • ν\nu is the egg laying rate;

  • pp is the fraction of mosquitoes that transition into a sugar feeding state after laying eggs; the remaining 1−p1-p transition into a blood feeding state.

  • ζ\zeta is rate that blood feeding mosquitoes switch to sugar feeding

  • θ\theta is rate gravid mosquitoes resorb their eggs, reverting to a blood feeding state; while we do not explicitly model opportunistic sugar feeding while laying eggs, we assume mosquitoes would remain in the egg laying state if sugar was readily available, so θ\theta could be described using a functional response to available sugar

  • Ωx\Omega_x is a state-specific dispersal matrix:

    • gxg_x is the state-specific mortality rate

    • σx\sigma_x is the state-specific emigration rate,

    • μx\mu_x is state-specific survival associated with

    • KxK_x the state-specific dispersal matrix;

    • The demographic matrix is Ωx=gx+σx(μx−Kx)\Omega_x = g_x + \sigma_x(\mu_x- K_x)

  • ξ\xi is the refeeding rate

  • η−1\eta^{-1} is the duration of the post-prandial resting period

Dynamics

Ṡ=Λ+ν(1−p)Q+ζB−ρS−ΩS⋅SḂ=ρS+(νp+θ)Q+ξR−(f+ζB)B−ΩB⋅BṘ=fB−(ξ+η+g)RQ̇=ηR−(ν+θ)Q−ΩQ⋅Q \begin{array}{rl} \dot S &= \Lambda + \nu (1-p) Q + \zeta B - \rho S - \Omega_S \cdot S \\ \dot B &= \rho S + (\nu p + \theta) Q + \xi R - (f + \zeta_B) B - \Omega_B \cdot B \\ \dot R &= f B - (\xi + \eta + g) R \\ \dot Q &= \eta R - (\nu + \theta) Q - \Omega_Q \cdot Q \end{array}

In this version, mosquitoes switch back into a blood feeding state after laying eggs. A parameter ζ\zeta determines whether the mosquitoes would switch into a sugar feeding state from either a blood feeding or egg laying state.

Note that since all sugar feeding mosquitoes transition into a blood feeding state, the transition into sugar feeding from egg laying implies the eggs have been reabsorbed.

Infection Dynamics

Variables

  • Each one of the behavioral states is replicated for each one of the infection states. The variable names add a subscript uu for uninfected; yy for infected but not yet infectious; and zz for infectious:

  • SuS_u, SyS_y, and SzS_z are the density of uninfected, infected but not infectious, and infectious sugar feeding mosquitoes.

  • BuB_u, ByB_y, and BzB_z are the density of uninfected, infected but not infectious, and infectious blood feeding mosquitoes.

  • RuR_u, RyR_y, and RzR_z are the density of uninfected, infected but not infectious, and infectious resting mosquitoes.

  • QuQ_u, QyQ_y, and QzQ_z are the density of uninfected, infected but not infectious, and infectious egg laying mosquitoes.

Terms

κ\kappa is the NI, the probability of becoming infected after blood feeding on a human

Parameters

  • ϕ−1\phi^{-1} is the EIP

  • qq is the human fraction for blood feeding

We present the following behavioral state model:

uninfected

Ṡu=Λ+ζBu+ν(1−p)Qu−ρSu−ΩS⋅SuḂu=ρSu+(νp+θ)Qu+ξR−(f+ζ)Bu−ΩB⋅BuṘu=f(1−qκ)Bu−(ξ+η+g)RuQ̇u=ηRu−(ν+θ)Qu−ΩQ⋅Qu \begin{array}{rl} \dot S_u &= \Lambda + \zeta B_u + \nu (1-p) Q_u - \rho S_u - \Omega_S \cdot S_u \\ \dot B_u &= \rho S_u + (\nu p+ \theta) Q_u + \xi R - (f + \zeta) B_u - \Omega_B \cdot B_u \\ \dot R_u &= f (1-q\kappa) B_u - (\xi + \eta + g) R_u \\ \dot Q_u &= \eta R_u - (\nu + \theta) Q_u- \Omega_Q \cdot Q_u \end{array} infected

Ṡy=ζBy+ν(1−p)Qy−ρSy−ΩS⋅Sy−ϕSyḂy=ρSy+(νp+θ)Qy+ξR−(f+ζ)By−ΩB⋅By−ϕByṘy=fqκBu+fBy−(ξ+η+g)Ry−ϕRyQ̇y=ηRy−(ν+ζ)Qy−ΩQ⋅Qy−ϕQy \begin{array}{rl} \dot S_y &= \zeta B_y + \nu (1-p) Q_y - \rho S_y - \Omega_S \cdot S_y -\phi S_y\\ \dot B_y &= \rho S_y + (\nu p + \theta) Q_y + \xi R - (f + \zeta) B_y - \Omega_B \cdot B_y -\phi B_y\\ \dot R_y &= f q \kappa B_u + f B_y- (\xi + \eta + g) R_y - \phi R_y\\ \dot Q_y &= \eta R_y - (\nu + \zeta) Q_y- \Omega_Q \cdot Q_y - \phi Q_y \end{array}

infectious

Ṡz=ϕSy+ζBz+ν(1−p)Qz−ρSz−ΩS⋅SzḂz=ϕBy+(νp+θ)Qz+ρSz+ξR−(f+ζ)Bz−ΩB⋅BzṘz=ϕRy+fBz−(ξ+η+g)RzQ̇z=ϕQy+ηRz−(ν+θ)Qz−ΩQ⋅Qz \begin{array}{rl} \dot S_z &= \phi S_y + \zeta B_z + \nu (1-p) Q_z - \rho S_z - \Omega_S \cdot S_z \\ \dot B_z &= \phi B_y + (\nu p + \theta) Q_z + \rho S_z + \xi R - (f + \zeta) B_z - \Omega_B \cdot B_z \\ \dot R_z &= \phi R_y + f B_z - (\xi + \eta + g) R_z \\ \dot Q_z &= \phi Q_y + \eta R_z - (\nu + \theta) Q_z- \Omega_Q \cdot Q_z \end{array}
